entry.title: France ‚Äòalways by your side,‚Äô says top diplomat on first trip to Armenia

media:group.media:title: France ‚Äòalways by your side,‚Äô says top diplomat on first trip to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç France‚Äôs top diplomat pledged continued support for Armenia and urged Azerbaijan to engage in normalization talks in good faith. üìç Bagrat Galstanyan, Armenia‚Äôs archbishop turned protest leader, visited parliament for meetings with members of the country‚Äôs two main opposition groups. üìç Russia‚Äôs deputy prime minister said his country acknowledges Armenia‚Äôs sovereignty in efforts to reopen regional transit routes, in an apparent attempt at damage control. üìç This Week in Business: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t51xQA9qCGw

media:group.media:title: Pursuing Justice for Armenian Victims
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, Judge Gassia Apkarian, a prominent figure in the Superior Court of Orange County and leader of the Armenian Center for Truth and Justice, delves into the complex legal challenges facing Armenia and Karabakh Armenians. She addresses the critical issue of prosecuting Azerbaijani war crimes, exploring the tension between pursuing justice and negotiating peace. Judge Apkarian also offers invaluable insights on advocating for the rights of displaced Armenians, particularly the right of return, in the face of political obstacles and government inaction.

entry.title: Global scholars discuss the role of microhistory in Armenian academia

media:group.media:title: Global scholars discuss the role of microhistory in Armenian academia
media:group.media:description:
‚ÄúFrom Menocchio to Manuzzi: Conversations on Microhistory and the Global‚Äù highlighted the significance of microhistory in Armenian scholarship. The special event, which took place as part of the Yerevan Dialogue 2024 at the Cafesjian Center for the Arts in Armenia, featuring insights from renowned historians like Sebouh David Aslanian, Giovanni Levi, Carlo Ginzburg and Sanjay Subrahmanyam. The conversation explored the potential of microhistory in uncovering broader narratives through intimate, detailed historical accounts. With new translations of key works into Western Armenian, this marks a milestone in making complex histories accessible to Armenian scholars and students.

media:group.media:title: Garo Paylan on Armenia-Turkey's Future
media:group.media:description:
Former Turkish parliamentarian Garo Paylan sits down with CivilNet for a candid assessment of Turkey's democratic decline and its implications for the region. Paylan, known for his advocacy of minority rights and cross-border dialogue, shares his insights on the potential opening of the Armenia-Turkey border and outlines a vision for meaningful reconciliation between the two nations. Drawing from his unique perspective as an ethnic Armenian politician in Turkey, Paylan discusses the challenges and opportunities that lie ahead in fostering improved relations and strengthening democratic institutions in both countries.

entry.title: The Legal Case For Genocide In Karabakh

media:group.media:title: The Legal Case For Genocide In Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
In this interview, Luis Moreno Ocampo, the first prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, delves into the complex legal landscape of genocide, ethnic cleansing, and international justice. Drawing from his extensive experience, Ocampo provides crucial insights into the application of these terms to the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict and elucidates the challenges in prosecuting such cases on the global stage. The conversation then shifts to Ocampo's pivotal role in Argentina's democratic transition, offering valuable lessons and perspectives that could inform Armenia's own journey towards a more robust democracy.

entry.title: Armenia walks back controversial tax proposal after business leaders protest: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia walks back controversial tax proposal after business leaders protest: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank cut interest rates by 25 basis points to 7.5%, as inflation in the country continues to remain well below target levels and the economy continues to grow. üìç Lawmakers will abandon a plan to toughen tax evasion penalties after business leaders raised concerns over the proposed changes‚Äô potential impact on the private sector. üìç Interview with WinesofArmenia.com‚Äôs Stepan Baghdassarian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PTpUC6GrT-c

entry.title: Armenian defense minister in Beijing to explore closer ties

media:group.media:title: Armenian defense minister in Beijing to explore closer ties
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenian Prime Minister Pashinyan and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken discussed the state of normalization talks with Azerbaijan. üìç Armenian and Chinese defense ministers met in Beijing to talk about opportunities for closer military ties. üìç Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko expressed hopes for improved ties with Armenia, while strictly blaming Yerevan for the crisis in relations. üìç Insights With Eric Hacopian: Who is to blame for losing the war? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xjqgeAugjMg

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòSky‚Äôs the limit‚Äô on Armenia‚Äôs wine renaissance
media:group.media:description:
Stepan Baghdassarian, founder and CEO of WinesofArmenia.com, sits down with CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich to talk about the challenges and opportunities he has as one of the biggest importers of Armenian wines to the United States. Stepan discusses the current state of Armenian winemaking and what the future holds for the burgeoning industry.
‚ÄúArmenia is going through a wine renaissance,‚Äù Stepan says. ‚ÄúWe were the leaders of winemaking, going back at least 6,200 years, possibly more. And we‚Äôre back. Sky‚Äôs the limit.‚Äù
0:00 What is WinesofArmenia.com? 1:52 How to market Armenian wine overseas? 3:27 Indigenous Armenian or European varietals? 5:02 What is Armenian wine‚Äôs competitive advantage? 8:56 What role should the Armenian government play? 11:24 Why is the UN conference on wine tourism in Armenia? 12:33 What story does Armenian wine tell?

13 —Å–µ–Ω—Ç—è–±—Ä—è 2022 –≥–æ–¥–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–∏–∫ –∞—Ç–∞–∫–æ–≤–∞–ª –≤ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö –ì–µ–≥–∞—Ä–∫—É–Ω–∏–∫–∞, –í–∞–π–æ—Ü –î–∑–æ—Ä–∞ –∏ –°—é–Ω–∏–∫–∞. –≠—Ç–∞ –¥–≤—É—Ö–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–∞—è –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∞ –±—ã–ª–∞ —Å–∞–º—ã–º –º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±–Ω—ã–º –≤–æ–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º –∞–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–≤–Ω—ã–º –¥–µ–π—Å—Ç–≤–∏–µ–º –ê–∑–µ—Ä–±–∞–π–¥–∂–∞–Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ 44-–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω–æ–π –≤–æ–π–Ω—ã –≤ –ù–∞–≥–æ—Ä–Ω–æ–º –ö–∞—Ä–∞–±–∞—Ö–µ. –ü–æ –æ—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–º –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–º, –∞—Ä–º—è–Ω—Å–∫–∞—è —Å—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–Ω–∞ –ø–æ–Ω–µ—Å–ª–∞ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ 224 –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä—å, –≤–∫–ª—é—á–∞—è 3 –º–∏—Ä–Ω—ã—Ö –∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π, –±—ã–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ–ø–∞–≤—à–∏–µ –±–µ–∑ –≤–µ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏ –≤–∑—è—Ç—ã–µ –≤ –ø–ª–µ–Ω, –∞ —Ç–∞–∫–∂–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–æ—Ç–µ—Ä–∏. –≠—Ç–∞ –∞—Ç–∞–∫–∞ –∏–∑–º–µ–Ω–∏–ª–∞ –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –≤–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ä –ê—Ä–º–µ–Ω–∏–∏, —É—Å—É–≥—É–±–∏–≤ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä—è–∂—ë–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤ –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è—Ö —Å –û–î–ö–ë –∏ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–µ–π.
